meanings.definition: In a harmful or damaging manner
meanings.sent1: He ran injuriously, tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent2: The car crashed injuriously into the tree.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown injuriously stumbled over his oversized shoes.
meanings.sent4: The storm injuriously swept away everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The poison spread injuriously through the water, affecting all the fish.

meanings.sent1: The injuriously sharp knife sliced through the paper effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The injuriously hot stove burned his hand when he touched it.
meanings.sent3: The injuriously spicy chili made his mouth feel like it was on fire.
meanings.sent4: The injuriously loud music made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The injuriously cold wind chilled them to the bone.
